metadata.title: CVE-2018-12122 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Node.js: All versions prior to Node.js 6.15.0, 8.14.0, 10.14.0 and 11.3.0: Slowloris HTTP Denial of Service: An attacker can cause a Denial of Service (DoS) by sending headers very slowly keeping HTTP or HTTPS connections and associated resources alive for a long period of time. Jan Maybach discovered that Nde.js did not time out if incomplete HTTP/HTTPS headers were received. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service by keeping HTTP/HTTPS connections alive for a long period of time.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12122` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode108 - 10.15.1~dfsg-5
nodejs - 10.15.1~dfsg-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.15.1~dfsg-5').
